alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 10:54PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jackson and northeastern DeKalb Counties through 1130 PM CDT... At 1053 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Stevenson, or 9 miles southwest of Bridgeport, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridgeport, Stevenson, Fabius and Higdon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Alabama.
